comment: Watching a performance at the Bolshoi was something of a lifelong dream. The performance did not disappoint. Beautiful sets and costumes, amazing dancers, a world class orchestra. The theater itself is the height of beauty.  But, the performance was completely ruined by the incredibly rude people that talked throughout the performance, the woman in front of me who spent the whole performance texting someone, and the 20 or so people who were constantly taking pictures and videos on their phones, many of them using bright flashes.  And to top it off, none of the Bolshoi staff seemed to care. Try using your phone at the Kennedy Center in Washington DC and you will be thrown out. Apparently the Bolshoi dors not care about rude people distracting others during a performance. I paid close to $400 to look at people's phones for 2 hours.  People who cannot get through a beautiful ballet without touching their phones are weak of mind and rude.

Well... As exchange students we put our name on the list early morning and came early to pay for our tickets. After we entered and showed our student ID the woman said she won't sell tickets to foreigners only if some are left at the end of the queue. Never encountered such racist behaviour.
